summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from June-July 2020 discussing the need for assistance with a 'taint review' related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The emails show FBI agents coordinating to allocate personnel for this specialized task, indicating ongoing investigative work on the case.

persons.name: Randy
persons.context: Referred to by first name in an email, appears to be an FBI agent from a different field office (possibly TD) who is offering assistance with the Epstein case taint review.

persons.name: Jen
persons.context: Sent an initial forwarded email on June 18, 2020, requesting assistance for the taint review from Squad C-2, describing it as a 'unique opportunity' on a high-profile investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The case for which the FBI is conducting a taint review is explicitly identified as the 'Jeffrey Epstein case'.

connections.description: FBI agents coordinating across field offices (NY and possibly TD) to secure assistance for a taint review on the Epstein case.
Both appear to be FBI employees in the New York Field Office, with Jen helping to disseminate the request for assistance on the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial request for taint review assistance
events.description: FBI Special Agent N. from the New York Field Office sends an email seeking assistance for a taint review related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Formal assistance request circulated
events.description: An email from Jen is forwarded, formally requesting assistance for the taint review from Squad C-2, describing it as connected to the Jeffrey Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination for CAIR account setup
events.description: Email discussion about setting up a CAIR (likely an FBI system) account for an assisting agent to access the review, with a proposed start date.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively working on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation as of June-July 2020, conducting a 'taint review'â€”a legal process to separate privileged from non-privileged material.
The request for assistance came from the FBI New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad, specifically from Squad C-2.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination across different field offices (NY and TD) to allocate resources for this high-profile case.
Access to the review required a 'CAIR account' on the 'high side' (likely a classified or secure system), indicating the sensitive nature of the material.
The case was described internally as a 'unique opportunity to work on a high profile investigation'.
